 How Autism Works  Some children seem to live in a world all their own. They
appear distant and closed-in, avoiding eye contact and shying away from their
parents' hugs, and may exhibit strange behaviors. These children are among
approximately 1.5 million in America
who have autism. Learn about the causes and symptoms of
autism and the treatments and help available for autistic children.
Also at HowStuffWorks
 

How Aromatherapy Works - Aromatherapy is a popular form of alternative medicine that uses the smell from essential oils to treat a variety of conditions. Learn about the history of aromatherapy, how to do aromatherapy at home and what conditions some people think may be improved by aromatherapy treatment.
 

How Political Conventions Work - The next presidential election is 18 months away, but the
campaign season is already here. Find out how political conventions work to
choose presidential candidates and why conventions are an important part of the
election process.
 

How Self-Publishing Works - Thanks to the development of print-on-demand services,
self-publishing offers great opportunities to writers with an entrepreneurial
instinct or those who simply wish to produce a bound copy of their work for
themselves and some friends. Discover the world of self-publishing, and find
out if itâ\u20ac™s a viable alternative to working with a traditional publisher.
